title: Inside look at the mind of someone who gets flamed
body:
player makes a misplay at a crucial point in the game, unfortuante, happens to everyone, game still very winnable, but they couldve won if said player did better

player: (in mind) dang that sucked, i never want that to happen again, ill do better next fight

team: oblivious that the player already knows what he did wrong: wow you're so trash stop feeding you retard

player: (in mind) well that was rude, oh well, i guess people are just toxic

next fight player does better, but not enough to win them the fight and they lose 2 inhibitors. he wasnt the only one who misplayed, but his seemed the worst because he was the last to die and everyoen was watching him,

the team flames him again, blaming the entire game on him.

player in mind: im really not feeling like trying anymore, if all i get is blame, who cares if we lose anyway, its just a game.

player proceeds to give up mentally and is no longer playing at his best or even making an effort to



i see it all the time, with other people, with the enemy team, with me. the same thing, flame just results in them playing worse. just dont flame

replies.body: This is what happens when spanking your kids becomes "child abuse"

Lol... not really. This is constant verbal abuse on somebody for mis-clicking or not seeing an opportunity, etc. Spanking has nothing to do with it. Your parents aren't your teammates. Your teammates are the people you are supposed to work with and help to work together toward the objective of winning the game.

It's not a hard concept, and your cop-out "zinger" reply is a great telling of what side of that spectrum you're on.
